_comment: Orca Slicer Profile - Silk PLA Bronze Aesthetic Parts for Qidi Q2

filament_settings.chamber_temperature_note: Do NOT use chamber heating with PLA - it will cause heat creep and jams

print_settings.layer_height_note: Finer layers for better silk sheen and dragon detail
print_settings.top_shell_layers_note: Extra top layers for smooth silk finish on lid surface
print_settings.ironing_note: ENABLE IRONING for the lid - gives the dragon relief a polished bronze look
print_settings.outer_wall_speed_note: SLOW outer walls = better silk PLA sheen. This is key!
print_settings.top_surface_speed_note: Very slow top surface for maximum silk metallic effect
print_settings.support_note_dragon_knob: Dragon knob MAY need tree supports for the horns - preview in slicer first
print_settings.seam_position_note: Hide seam on the back of the lid

quality_notes: CRITICAL: Do NOT use chamber heating with Silk PLA!
Open the chamber door/remove enclosure lid for PLA printing
Silk PLA looks best with SLOW outer wall speeds (60mm/s or less)
ENABLE IRONING on the lid for a polished bronze dragon surface
0.16mm layer height gives optimal detail for dragon scales and relief
The metallic sheen direction follows the print path - aligned seams help
For the dragon knob: consider printing at 0.12mm for extra detail
Claw feet: print with ball facing up for best claw detail
Corner accents: print standing vertically for best scale pattern
If you have bronze AND green silk, consider green for the lid and bronze for accents
Post-processing tip: a light coat of clear satin spray enhances silk PLA

print_orientation.lid: Print UPSIDE DOWN (top surface on bed) for best dragon relief quality. Lip faces up.
print_orientation.lid_alternative: Or print right-side up with ironing enabled for top surface finish
print_orientation.dragon_knob: Print upright with post facing down. Tree supports for horns if needed.
print_orientation.corner_accents: Print standing vertically (tall dimension = Z axis)
print_orientation.claw_feet: Print with flat mounting surface on bed, claws pointing up
